Assignment prob
  • Offshore-Production-Problem
  • 1. Problem Statement
  • View page source

1. Problem Statement

We have 2 offshore production plants in 2 locations and an estimated demand for our products.

We want to produce a schedule of production from both plants that meets our demand with the lowest cost.

A factory can be in 2 states:

  • Off – Producing zero units

  • On – Producing between its minimum and maximum production capacities

2. Sets and Indices

2.1. Sets

I: set of all factories, I = {0,1}

J: set of all months, J = {0,1,2.….11}

2.2. Indices

i: Denotes the factory number/index, \(i\ \epsilon I\ \)

j: Denotes the month number/index,\(\ \ \ \ j\ \epsilon\ J\)

3. LP Formulation

Formulating the problem as an ILP problem

3.1. Decision Variables

  • \(x_{ij}\) : Quantity produced in factory ‘i’ in month ‘j’

All \(x_{ij}\) are integers as quantity produced can’t be a fraction

  • \(y_{ij}\ :\ \)Represents the open or closed status a factory ‘i’ in month ‘j’

\(y_{ij} = \left\{ \begin{array}{r} 1\ if\ factory{\ 'i}^{'}\ is\ open\ in\ month\ 'j' \\ 0\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ Otherwise \end{array} \right.\ \)

3.2. Parameters

\(Var\_ cost_{ij}\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ :\ \ \ \)Variable cost of production in factory ‘i’ in the month ‘j’

\(Fixe{d\_ cost}_{ij}\ \ \ \ \ \ :\) Fixed cost of production in factory ‘i’ in the month ‘j’

\(Demand_{j}\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ :\) Demand to be met at month ‘j’

\(Minim\_ capacity_{ij}\ :\ \) Minimum quantity that should be produced by factory i in month j

\(Maxim\_ capacity_{ij}\ :\) Maximum quantity that should be produced by factory i in month j

3.3. Objective Function

Minimize: \(\sum_{j\epsilon J}^{}{(Var\_ cost_{ij}*x_{ij} + Fixed\_\cos t_{ij}\ }*{\ y_{ij})}_{\ }\ \ \ \ \ \ \forall i\ \epsilon\ I\)

3.3. Constraints

  • Production-Demand Constraint:

The sum of quantities produced from each of the factories in a month must be equal to the demand in that month

\[\sum_{i\epsilon I}^{}{{(x}_{ij} = Demand_{ij}})\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \forall\ j\ \epsilon\ J\]

  • Capacity constraints

    • Minimum capacity constraint:

Production at each factory a month should be greater than the minimum production limit of the factory that month given that the factory is open in that month

\[x_{ij} \geq minim\_ capacity_{ij}*y_{ij}\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \forall i\ \epsilon\ I\ \ and\ \ \forall\ \ j\epsilon J\]

  • Maximum capacity constraint:

Production at each factory a month should be less than the minimum production limit of the factory that month given that the factory is open in that month

\[x_{ij} \leq \ maxim\_ capacity_{ij}*y_{ij}\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \forall i\ \epsilon\ I\ \ and\ \ \forall\ \ j\epsilon J\]

  • Sign Constraints:

The decision variables for production quantity considered should be non-negative

\(x_{ij} \geq 0\ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \ \) \(\forall\ i\epsilon I\ and\ \ j\epsilon J\)

\(y_{ij}\epsilon\left\{ 0,1 \right\}\ \) \(\forall\ i\epsilon I\ \ and\ \ j\epsilon J\)
